content.question: Which of the following historical circumstances best explains why Palmerston chose to describe the charge of the Light Brigade in the way that he did?

choices.label: Karl Marx had recently begun to publish his theories about the inevitability of class struggle.
The British political system was gradually affording more representation and political power to members of the lower classes.
Improvements in weaponry were making cavalry charges an outmoded tactic by the 1850s.
Industrialization in Britain created a new upper class whose sources of income were different from those of the traditional aristocracy.

content.answer: The British political system was gradually affording more representation and political power to members of the lower classes.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
